title: Bitcoin Falls 10% In Bearish Trade
text:
Investing.com - Bitcoin was trading at $9,139.8 by 21:47 (01:47 GMT) on the Investing.com Index on Sunday, down 10.43% on the day. It was the largest one-day percentage loss since September 24.

The move downwards pushed Bitcoin's market cap down to $165.5B, or 67.03% of the total cryptocurrency market cap. At its highest, Bitcoin's market cap was $241.2B.

Bitcoin had traded in a range of $9,129.6 to $9,359.6 in the previous twenty-four hours.

Over the past seven days, Bitcoin has seen a rise in value, as it gained 15.09%. The volume of Bitcoin traded in the twenty-four hours to time of writing was $40.3B or 30.97% of the total volume of all cryptocurrencies. It has traded in a range of $7,329.2031 to $10,540.0000 in the past 7 days.

At its current price, Bitcoin is still down 54.00% from its all-time high of $19,870.62 set on December 17, 2017.

Elsewhere in cryptocurrency trading

Ethereum was last at $178.49 on the Investing.com Index, down 4.79% on the day.

XRP was trading at $0.29036 on the Investing.com Index, a loss of 4.04%.

Ethereum's market cap was last at $19.5B or 7.88% of the total cryptocurrency market cap, while XRP's market cap totaled $12.6B or 5.10% of the total cryptocurrency market value.
